title-group.subtitle: Khan M et al. A noncontact laser-guided system for endoscopic computer-assisted sinus surgery. Surg Innov. 2012;19:308-315. doi:10.1177/1553350611426565

author-notes.corresp: Wolfgang Freysinger, PhD, Medical University Innsbruck, Anichstr 35, Innsbruck A-6020, Austria Email: Wolfgang.Freysinger@i-med.ac.at

body.p: We were astonished to read the new steps in technological development and assessment of a noncontact laser measuring endoscope in your journal in the following article:
Khan M, Kosmecki B, Reutter A, Ozbek C, Keeve E, Olze H. A noncontact laser-guided system for endoscopic computer-assisted sinus surgery. Surg Innov. 2012;19:308-315. doi:10.1177/1553350611426565
However, the authors do not properly acknowledge the public body of knowledge, namely, they do not acknowledge

list-item.p: (a) that this technology is due to our invention:

body.p: Kral F, Freysinger W. PCT Publication, Medical Navigation System, WO2007/068017.

list-item.p: (b) that this technology is protected by an Austrian patent:

body.p: Kral F, Freysinger W. Medizinisches Navigationssystem—Naviscope, Austrian Patent AT 502 919, December 2007.

list-item.p: (c) that we have first published the technology:

Kral F, Freysinger W. A novel device for navigated endoscopic surgery. 5th International Conference on Computer Aided Surgery Around the Head (CAS-H), Leipzig, German, February 6-9, 2008 (where the authors of the present publication were present).

At the German ENT meeting, Bonn, Germany, 2009: Kral F, Freysinger W. Naviscope—erste experimentelle Ergebnisse einer berührungslosen endoskopischen Navigation. http://www.egms.de/de/meetings/hnod2009/09hnod350.shtml.

At the World Congress of Medical Physics, Munich 2009: Kral F, Güler Ö, Bickel M, Puschban J, Freysinger W. Live endoscopic video streams augmented for 3D-navigation. In: Dössel O, Schlegel W, eds. WC 2009, IFMBE Proceedings 25/VI; 2009:293-295. Berlin, Germany: Springer, ISBN 978-3-642-03897-6.

body.p: Thus, to comply with good scientific practice, we ask this comment to be published in Surgical Innovation at the earliest time possible.
We thank you for your understanding and your adequate response to secure the scientific and ethical standard of Surgical Innovation.
